H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H1377.def: = woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

H5631.def: = a male who has been castrated and made to serve in the women's quarters in the royal palace

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H8227.def: = Syrian Rock Hyrax; animal with small round ears, no visible tail, and short legs, lives on leaves and herbs; two of their front teeth develop into small tusks; can run up almost vertical rock faces and climb trees with ease; ◄ procavia capensis syriaca; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with small size and wisdom

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6964.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Maaseiah<SDBH:מַעֲשֵׂיָה>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► ancestor of {L:Sallu<SDBH:סַלּוּא>}, after exile

H6667.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Chenaanah<SDBH:כְּנַעֲנָה>}; ► false prophet; time of king {L:Ahab<SDBH:אַחְאָב>}

H5012.def: = action by which humans speak or act as a prophet

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5019.def: = man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} from 605-562 B.C. who led the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>} into exile

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H894.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Mesopotamia<SDBH:שִׁנְעָר>}; ► founded by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>}; location of "tower of Babel"; capital of {L:Chaldean<SDBH:כַּשְׂדִּים>} empire

H1546.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H894.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Mesopotamia<SDBH:שִׁנְעָר>}; ► founded by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>}; location of "tower of Babel"; capital of {L:Chaldean<SDBH:כַּשְׂדִּים>} empire

H7045.def: = actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6667.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Chenaanah<SDBH:כְּנַעֲנָה>}; ► false prophet; time of king {L:Ahab<SDBH:אַחְאָב>}

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7033.def: = causative action by which humans expose other humans to the heat of fire; ► which will result in excessive suffering and/or death; ≈ also used in a more figurative sense for the burning sensation caused by high fever

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
